title: Medium's
content:
do you believe in them?

[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Medium_%28spirituality%29]wikipedia entry if you have no idea what i am talking about[/url][url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://i11.photobucket.com/albums/a199/rorie1983/ironmaiden.jpg[/img][/url]

title: Mediation/
content:
With the things I've seen, I'd be hard pressed to deny the existence of existence beyond the death of the physical shell. Assuming by "Medium's", which creates a syntax error and renders the question unanswerable, you mean "Mediums", then my vote goes to yes.

However, there are a lot of charlatans out there, and it's a much harder thing to police than a scam based entirely the physical world. Thus one needs to be careful which so-called medium one believes in. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Mediation/
content:
Exactly! ANd then of course, how do you *really* know who you're talking to?

I'd say maybe 1/10 of them is legit, with maybe 3/10 actually just *thinking* they're legit. Mind you, it wouldn't surprise me if they were all fakes, just as it wouldn't surprise me if we were the only lifeforms in the universe.

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Medium's
content:

But maybe some agnostics do.
